meanings.definition: Jutties (verb): to project or extend outward
meanings.sent1: The tree jutties its branches towards the sky.
meanings.sent2: The ship's bow jutties out over the water.
meanings.sent3: The curious squirrel jutties its head out of the hole to peek around.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm jutties out in everything she does.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower jutties towards the sunlight for energy.

meanings.definition: Jutties (noun): a projecting part of a building, such as a balcony or overhang
meanings.sent1: The old house had beautiful jutties that added charm to its exterior.
meanings.sent2: The castle's jutties provided a perfect spot to overlook the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons often gather on the jutties of the cathedral, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The jutties of the skyscraper reached towards the clouds, touching the sky.
meanings.sent5: The jutties of the theater created interesting shadows in the afternoon sun.
